title: Changes to Secure English Language Test Providers for UK Visas

details.body:
Two new providers have been selected to deliver approved Secure English Language Tests and will replace current providers from 6 April 2015.

The two new test providers are:

  • Trinity College London (for customers applying in the UK only)
  • IELTS SELT Consortia (for visa customers applying outside or inside the UK)

The new SELT test centres are spread throughout world and will continue to provide easy access for applicants, and we will also be introducing a number of new ‘pop-up’ centres in locations where testing was previously not available. Applicants should go online to find out where their nearest test centre is located and for information on how to book a test.

Transitional arrangements

Applicants who have already taken their SELT test but who have not yet applied for their visa should not be concerned. Those who have taken the language test on or before 5 April 2015 with the current providers will be able to use their certificates to support their visa applications until 5 November 2015.

Applicants who have not yet taken a SELT test should only book a test with a new provider from 6 April. Tests taken with old providers from 6 April will not be accepted.

government.title: 2010 to 2015 Conservative and Liberal Democrat coalition government

description: UK Visas and Immigration is making changes to the Secure English Language Tests (SELT) required by some applicants for student visas.
